thread.title: Leicester City handed clash against Atletico Madrid in Champions League quarter-finals
thread.title_full: Leicester City handed clash against Atletico Madrid in Champions League quarter-finals

author: Joe Mewis
title: Leicester City handed clash against Atletico Madrid in Champions League quarter-finals
text:
The Foxes have discovered their quarter-final opponents (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Leicester City have been drawn against Atletico Madrid in the quarter-finals of the Champions League . 
Craig Shakespeare's men are the last remaining Premier League in the competition and will now face Diego Simeone's side over two legs month. 
The Foxes secured their place in the quarters with a surprise win over Sevilla. After losing the first leg in Spain they sacked Claudio Ranieri, less than a year after he lifted the Premier League title. 
Shakespeare has been handed the reigns at the King Power until the end of the season, with the Foxes winning all three games he has taken charge of so far. 
It will be memorable for everyone at the football club. We might just be the surprise team," he said. 
Asked if any of the team had holidays or weddings lined up for the Saturday of the Champions League final, winger Marc Albrighton replied: “No, not as yet. 
"We will continue to enjoy this and see how far we can go. You don’t enter a competition and aim not to win. 
“We want to go all the way — and believe we can. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
